intro: Marrubium gamodon, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive grayish-green color, and its flowers bloom in yellow or orange hues. Marrubium gamodon is often found in grasslands, along roadsides, and in disturbed areas, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
